data.title: Public Notices
data.meta_description: LETTERS TESTAMENTA RY, on the Estate of MARY RUTH LANDVATER AKA MARY R. LANDVATER, of Derry Township, Dauphin County, Pennsylvan ia, deceased, having been granted to the undersigned, all persons indebted to the said Estate are requested to make immediate payment and those having claims to present the same without delay to: Executor: Jeremy R.
data.text:
LETTERS TESTAMENTA RY, on the Estate of MARY RUTH LANDVATER AKA MARY R. LANDVATER, of Derry Township, Dauphin County, Pennsylvan ia, deceased, having been granted to the undersigned, all persons indebted to the said Estate are requested to make immediate payment and those having claims to present the same without delay to: Executor: Jeremy R. Landvater 310 Leaward Terrace Swansboro, NC 28584 Or to: Attorney: Jennifer M. Merx, Esq. SkarlatosZonarich, LLC 320 Market St., Ste. 600W Harrisburg, PA 17101 Estate of Linda A. Snyder late of Lower Swatara Township, Dauphin County, deceased March 25, 2023. Letters of Testamentary on said estate having been granted to the undersigned, all persons indebted thereto are requested to make payment and those having claims against the same will present them without delay. Cynthia A. Yeager, Esquire Cynthia A. Yeager Law Offices 701 Logan Boulevard Altoona, PA 16602 Executrix and Attorney for the Estate

ESTATE NOTICE Letters of Administration in the George D. Plott, Jr., Estate, deceased on 08/16/23, late of Middletown, Dauphin County, Pennsylvania, have been granted to Sandy L. Adams, Administratrix. All persons indebted to the Estate are requested to make immediate payment and those having claims will present them for settlement without delay to Counsel for the Estate: David C. Miller, Jr., Esquire 1846 Bonnie Blue Lane Middletown, PA 17057 (717) 939-9806 Email: davidcmillerjr@verizon.net RE: Estate of MATTHEW DAVID NAPOLEONI, late of Washington Township, Dauphin County, Pennsylvania (died March 16, 2023). Notice is hereby given that Letters Administration for the Estate have been issued to ARIELL NAPOLEONI, Administratrix of the Estate. All those having claims or demands against the Estate or indebtedness owed to the Estate shall present claims or remit payment without delay to the Administratrix, or to John J. McGovern, Jr., Attorney for the Estate, 321 Spruce Street – Suite 201, Scranton, PA 18503.

IN THE COURT OF

COMMON PLEAS

OF DAUPHIN COUNTY

PENNSYLVANIA

DOCKET NO:

2023-CV-5832-NC

PETITION FOR

CHANGE OF NAME

NOTICE NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that on July 31 2023 the Petition of Arin Kelly Ayala was filed in the above named court, requesting a decree to change his/her name from Arin Kelly Ayala to Aaron Anthony Ayala. The Court has fixed November 6th 2023 at 1:30 P.M. in Courtroom No. 9, Floor 2, Dauphin County Courthouse, 101 Market Street, Harrisburg, PA 17101 as the time and place for the hearing on said Petition, when and where all persons interested may appear and show cause if any they have, why the prayer of the said Petition should not be granted.

IN THE COURT OF

COMMON PLEAS

OF DAUPHIN COUNTY

PENNSYLVANIA

DOCKET NO:

2023-CV-1215-NC

PETITION FOR

CHANGE OF NAME

NOTICE NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that on February 16 2023 the Petition of Precious was filed on behalf of minor child J-M.O.W in the above named court, requesting a decree to change child’s name from J-M.O.W to A.O.W. The Court has fixed October 3rd 2023 at 9:00 in Courtroom No. 9, Floor 2, Dauphin County Courthouse, 101 Market Street, Harrisburg, PA 17101 as the time and place for the hearing on said Petition, when and where all persons interested may appear and show cause if any they have, why the prayer of the said Petition should not be granted. Attorney:

LOWER PAXTON

TOWNSHIP

DAUPHIN COUNTY, PA EMERGENCY REPAIRS TO THE WASTEWATER

AND STORMWATER COLLECTION SYSTEM 2023-2024 CONTRACT Lower Paxton Township will receive sealed bids online via PennBid for the Maintenance and Emergency Repairs to the Wastewater and Stormwater Collection Systems in accordance with the Contract Documents. Sealed bids may be submitted and updated online via the Penn Bid Program until October 27, 2023 at 10:00 am when bids will be opened by GHD. Bid results will be read aloud shortly thereafter at LOWER PAXTON TOWNSHIP, 425 Prince Street, Harrisburg, PA 17109. The work consists of emergency repairs to the Lower Paxton Township wastewater and stormwater collection systems as needed. Bids shall be evaluated on a unit price basis as indicated in the pricing form. Quantities shown are for bid evaluation purposes only, Quantities are not guaranteed. All documents and solicitation details are available at no cost at Penn Bid. To access this solicitation, go to https:// pe nnbid.procureware.com and click on “Bids” on the left-hand side of the website. Search the “number” column for “Lower Paxton Township – GHD”. The “title” of the project is “ Emergency Repairs to the Wastewater and Stormwater Collection System ”. A fee 0.33% of the total work awarded, capped at $5,000, is assessed only to the bidder who is awarded the project. Each Proposal shall be accompanied by a Certified Check or Bid Bond payable to LOWER PAXTON TOWNSHIP in an amount of not less than ten percent (10%) of the total bid in accordance with the provisions in the Instructions to Bidders. Each Proposal must be complete, and the right is reserved to reject any and all Proposals and to accept any Proposal deemed to be most favorable to the interests of LOWER PAXTON TOWNSHIP. LOWER PAXTON TOWNSHIP is an equal opportunity employer. Successful bidder will be required to furnish and pay for satisfactory Performance and Payment Bonds in an amount equal to one hundred percent (100%) of the contract price within fifteen (15) days of receiving a Notice of Award letter. By: Bradley Gotshall, Manager, Owner: Lower Paxton Township

Articles of Amendment –

Municipal Authority Notice is hereby given that Articles of Amendment to the Articles of Incorporation of the West Hanover Township Authority, a municipal authority with its registered office located at 7171 Allentown Boulevard, Harrisburg, PA 17112, will be filed on or about October 12, 2023, with the Department of State of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania pursuant to the provisions of the Municipality Authorities Act, 53 Pa.C.S. § 5601, et seq. The nature and character of the Articles of Amendment is to extend the Authority’s term of existence for a period of 50 years and to expressly provide for stormwater planning, management, and implementa tion. The amendment to the Articles of Incorporation will become effective on the date of filing with the Department of State of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Salzmann Hughes, P.C. 1801 Market Street, Suite 300 Camp Hill, PA 17011

NOTICE OF

INCORPORATION Notice is hereby given that a nonprofit corporation has been incorporated under the provisions of the Pennsylvania Nonprofit Corporation Law of 1988, as amended, for the following nonprofit corporation: Name: TIM Heroes, Inc. Registered Office: 3 Shirley Drive, Middletown, PA 17057 Purpose: To raise awareness of the Pennsylvania Move Over Law and Distracted Driving Awareness and to provide resources and training to emergency responders, including law enforcement, fire, EMS, towing, 911, HazMat, DOT, and other roadway responders. The corporation has been organized under the Nonprofit Corporation Law exclusively for charitable, educational, and scientific purposes, including, for such purposes, the making of distributions to organizations that qualify as exempt organizations under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. The corporation is a nonprofit corporation; no part of its net earnings will benefit any private shareholder or individual. Todd A. Leiss Incorporator NOTICE OF SERVICE OF PROCESS OF PUBLICATION STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA COUNTY OF RANDOLPH IN THE GENERAL COURT OF JUSTICE DISTRICT COURT DIVISION JUVENILE DEPARTMENT RANDOLPH COUNTY FILE NO. 20 JA 236 and 20 JT 236 IN RE: ROSALIA MARIE MAXWELL TO: FATHER, DANIEL RICHARD MAXWELL FATHER OF ROSALIA MARIE MAXWELL, A FEMALE CHILD BORN ON OR ABOUT APRIL 6, 2017, IN GUILFORD COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA. TAKE NOTICE that a juvenile petition with respect to the above-described child has been filed in the above-enti tled proceeding.You are required and directed to make a defense of such pleading by filing an Answer to the Petition in this proceeding within forty (40) days after the first publication of this notice, exclusive of such date. The Answer must be filed with the Clerk of Superior Court no later than November 8, 2023.A Pre-Trial is scheduled at 9:00 on October 25, 2023, and Termination of Parental Rights Hearing is scheduled at 9:00 a.m. on November 1, 2023, at the Randolph County District Court, Courtroom #1B, Randolph County Courthouse, 176 E. Salisbury Street, Asheboro, North Carolina. You are entitled to attend any hearings affecting your parental rights. If you are indigent, you have a right to appointed counsel. If you request counsel, do so at or before the time of the hearing. You are further noticed that this a new proceeding and any attorney. heretofore appointed to represent you will represent you in this proceeding. Upon your failure to file an Answer to the Petition within the time prescribed, the Petitioner, the Randolph County Department of Social Services, will apply to the Court for relief sought in the Petition, UP TO AN INCLUDING POSSIBLE TERMINATION OF YOUR PARENTAL RIGHTS with respect to the above-described minor child. This the 28th day of September 2023. Chrystal Kay, Staff Attorney, Randolph County Department of Social Services Post Office Box 3239 Asheboro, North Carolina 27204 (336) 683-8050 Publish: September 28, 2023; November 5, 2023; November 12, 2023

ESTATE NOTICE ESTATE OF John D. Deimler a/k/a John David Deimler, late of Middletown, Dauphin County, PA. Notice is hereby given to request all persons having claims against the decedent to make known the same to the Executrix or attorney, and all persons indebted to the decedent to make payment to the Executrix without delay. Executrix: Wendy A. Deimler, c/o George W. Porter, Esquire, 909 E. Chocolate Ave., Hershey, PA 17033.

NOTICE Notice is hereby given that the Conewago Township Zoning Officer’s preliminary opinion is that the proposed use of the Hershey Soccer Club for the property with the address 2975 Elizabetht own Road, Elizabethtown PA 17022 complies with the Township’s Zoning Ordinance, specifically as follows: “The current use of the property at 2975 Elizabethtown Road, Conewago Township, Dauphin County is a golf driving range. As such, it is a commercial recreation facility under the terms of the Township Zoning Ordinance and a permitted use in the Commercial-General Zoning District in which the property is located. Your letter of September 1, 2023, advises that the intent is to convert the property from a driving range use to a synthetic turf soccer field use. It is my opinion as Township Zoning Officer that the use will remain a commercial recreation facility and remain a permitted use of the property; that is, it will remain “a place operated as a business and designed for the conduct of sports….” The plans and other materials related to this request and preliminary opinion may be examined by the public at the Conewago Township Municipal Building, 3279 Old Hershey Road, Elizabethtown, PA, 17022, Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. The time therein specified for commencing a proceeding with the Township’s Zoning Hearing Board shall run from the time when the second publication of this notice. Nikolaus & Hohenadel, Township Solicitor

C.S. 412.

TOWNSHIP OF SOUTH

HANOVER

ZONING HEARING

BOARD

Meeting Notification and

Legal Ad The Township of South Hanover Zoning Hearing Board will conduct a meeting and hearing to consider the following variance application on Monday, October 16, at the South Hanover Township Municipal Building located at 161 Patriot Way, Hershey, PA 17033. The hearing will commence at 7:00 PM. Docket No. 2023-01 – Variance filed by Justin T. Lowe, 2 Fox Run Road, Hummelstown, PA 17036, Property ID 56-013-133, which is zoned R-A – Residential Agriculture. The application is to consider a variance to Chapter 27–1508.1.H(1), of the Township of South Hanover Zoning Ordinance which limits the height of a fence in the front yard to 3.5’. The applicant is proposing a fence height of 5’ in the front yard of Fox Run Road. Any person with a disability requiring special accommodat ion to attend the hearing should notify the Township at (717) 566-0224 not less than three working days prior to the hearing. The Township will make every effort to provide a reasonable accommodat ion. All interested parties are invited to attend the hearing.

Fictitious Name Notice is hereby given that a Registration of Fictitious Name was filed in the Department of State of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania on August 30, 2023, for whatabout flooring d/b/a with a principal place of business located at 6059 Allentown Blvd STE 118, Harrisburg, PA 17112 in Dauphin County. The individual interested in this business is Faris A Rahman, also located at 6059 Allentown Blvd STE 118, Harrisburg, PA 17112. This is filed in compliance with 54 Pa.C.S. 311.

NOTICE OF HEARING

The Derry Township Zoning Hearing Board will hold a public hearing on Wednesday, October 11, 2023, at 6:00 PM in the Meeting Room of the Derry Township Municipal Complex, Administra tion Building, located at 600 Clearwater Rd., Hershey, PA. Beginning at the scheduled hour, the Board will consider the following petition:

Petition 2023-15 as filed by Hummelstown Investors, LLC, P.O. Box 429, Conshohocken, PA, 19428, regarding their property located at 570 Walton Ave., Hummelstown, PA, 17036, in the General Commercial and General Sign Overlay zoning districts. The property is improved with a Taco Bell restaurant. Petitioner desires to raze the existing building and construct a new Taco Bell restaurant and new signage on the property. Relief is sought from, but not necessarily limited to, the total allowable sign area and the allowable number of signs per street frontage. The property is identified on the Dauphin County tax maps as 24-030-004

All interested parties are invited to attend.

TOWNSHIP OF SOUTH

HANOVER

PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that on October 10, 2023 at 6:30 p.m. the Board of Supervisors of the Township of South Hanover, Dauphin County, Pennsylvania will hold a public meeting at the Township of South Hanover Administrative Building, 161 Patriot Way, Hershey, Dauphin County, Pennsylvania 17033, at which meeting the Board of Supervisors will consider the enactment of a proposed ordinance amending the Code of Ordinances of the Township. The title and summary of the proposed ordinance amendment are as follows: ORDINANCE 7-2023 AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE TOWNSHIP OF SOUTH HANOVER, DAUPHIN COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA CODE OF ORDINANCES, CHAPTER 26 (STORMWATER MANAGEMENT), ARTICLE IX (INSPECTIONS), SECTION 26-901 (SCHEDULE OF INSPECTIONS) TO CLARIFY THE TOWNSHIP’S AUTHORITY RELATIVE TO INSPECTIONS AND FEE ASSESSMENT Article IX (Inspections) of Chapter 26 (Stormwater Management) of the Township of South Hanover Code of Ordinances shall be amended to update the provisions regarding the assessment of fees for stormwater management inspections. The full text of the proposed amendatory ordinance is on file for inspection and review without charge at the Township of South Hanover’s Administrative Office at 161 Patriot Way, Hershey, Dauphin County, Pennsylvania 17055. Copies are also available at The Sun, the newspaper publishing this notice, at 18 East Main Street, Hummelstown, PA 17036. If any person with a disability wishes to request that special accommodations be made to allow his or her participat ion, he or she is asked to contact Karleigh Killinger at (717) 566-0224 at least one business day in advance to make arrangements. BOARD OF SUPERVISORS OF THE TOWNSHIP OF SOUTH HANOVER

NOTICE OF AUDIT

TO LEGATEES, NEXT

OF KIN, CREDITORS

AND ALL OTHER PERSONS CONCERNED:

NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the following accounts have been filed by the respective accountants in the Office of the Register of Wills or with the Clerk of the Orphans’ Court Division of the Common Pleas of Dauphin County, as the case may be, and that the same shall be duly presented to the said Orphans’ Court Division at the Office of the Court Administra tor for Audit, Confirmation and Distribution of the said ascertained balances to and among those legally entitled thereto October 25, 2023. Pursuant to Pennsylvania Orphans’ Court Rule 2.7(b) (formerly Dauphin County Orphans’ Court Rule 6.10.1), objections to an account must be filed in writing with the Register or Clerk no later than the close of business on October 24, 2023. 1. FREDENBURGH, ROSEANNE M., Deceased, First and Final Account of Lynne Radosevic, Executrix. 2.STRUNK, JOHN C., Deceased, First and Final Account of Mark Himmelreich, Administrator. September 18, 2023 Jean Marfizo King Register of Wills & Clerk of the Orphans’ Court

Emrich Irrevocable Trust Dated May 9, 2003, Bret M. Wiest, Atty. Bentz, deceased, late of Harrisburg, Dauphin County, PA, have been granted to the undersigned Executrix. All persons, therefore, indebted to said estate are requested to make immediate payment, and those having just claims, will please present the same, duly authentica ted, for settlement, without delay. Charles A. Ritchie, Jr., Esquire Feather and Feather, P.C. 22 West Main Street Annville, PA 17003 ATTORNEY Madelynn R. Moyer, Executrix

PUBLIC NOTICE The Board of Supervisors of Lower Paxton Township hereby gives public notice that it will hold a public hearing to consider Resolution 2023-24 during the regular business meeting to be held on October 17, 2023 at 7:00 pm in the Township Municipal Building, 425 Prince Street, Harrisburg, PA. Resolution 2023-24 would approve a transfer of restaurant Liquor License No. R-9453 into Lower Paxton Township for use at 2017 EG Drive, Suite 500, in the Blue Ridge Village development. Following the public hearing the Board of Supervisors will consider adoption of Resolution 2023-24. A copy of Resolution 2023-24 may be examined without charge or a copy of the Resolution may be obtained for the cost to prepare the copy at the Lower Paxton Township Municipal Center during regular business hours. Resolution 2023-24 is also available on the Lower Paxton Township website: lowerpaxton-pa. gov.
